author: Tosadeac
title: Thong?
review:
Finally opened a package and discovered the Lifeguard figure.  I was super excited until I assembled him.  Red shorts are painted only on the front and side when he is standing straight.  The backs of the legs are yellow and give the appearance that he is wearing a thong!  Also when he flexes backwards you see the tops of the legs are yellow as well.  I feel like there could have been a little better attention to details with this minifigure.

Parts

A red lifeguard buoy and red binoculars.  

Overall opinion

I like the minifigure, just wish they had completed the paint job

author: Odeinoichus
title: Sand, Surf and Sun
review:
Set #71007 Lifeguard: In Series 2 we got a female lifeguard using a new piece, ten series later we get this male companion to help patrol the beaches of LEGO City.

This male Lifeguard has a singles-sided bare chested torso print and a leg print of swimming trunks with the initials J.T in the right leg. His accessories are a red rescue device and a pair of red binoculars for observing the swimmers on the beach. (Or at the pool.) He has a pair of stylish shades and a brown hair piece parted on one side.

Overall opinion, not the strongest offering from Series 12, however this minifigure does have a lot of uses, from the bare chested torso print to the very specific accessories. I recommend this as a parts figure, and for completists. Younger fans might like him for a complete set, however as I noted he isn't the strongest offering this series has to its name.

author: sideswinger
title: WORST of the SERIES!
review:
I personally really like Series 12, but there is one figure that I can't help but feel let down by, that being the Lifeguard. This series released in 2014 where it retailed for 4 US dollars.

On top of the figure is that side-swept hair-piece that does seem to fit this character. I've always loved the moulding surrounding it, and it is nice getting it in a dark brown colour here, and it was new for the figure in that colour. Honestly, it's my favourite part of this figure!

His face has a useful smirking expression, and his shades really sell the character. He lacks an alternate expression.

Though I already stated I'm not a huge fan of this figure, he has good parts and prints, and the torso certainly falls into the latter category. It was far from the first shirtless CMF, but I always enjoy getting variations of it. He doesn't have any back printing, which is a little more acceptable here than with some o there minifigures.

Problems arise with this figure when we get to his legs. See, they have some useful trunks printed on the front and sides, which are red with white strings. I appreciate how the red is plastered onto the sides as well, but there are obviously a few places that look off. The front has some yellow showing inside the legs, but it just looks plain bad at the back. I understand this was before dual-moulded legs, but it just doesn't look good coming from a 2014 figure.

He includes two accessories, the first of which are just red binoculars. They weren't a new piece, but they certainly aren't that common in that colour. He also packs a red buoy, which is the same colour as the buoy found with the Series 2 Lifeguard.

Overall, the hair, head, and torso with this figure are great, but the reason I don't like him is because of his exposed backside, and how darn similar he is to the Series 2 Lifeguard. This is already a bad choice with that in mind, but LEGO didn't even bother to change the colours on him. Series 12 is fantastic, but this is EASILY my least favourite of the set. He only scores 2 out of 5 from me.
